snippet: According to the report, most teachers in the nation’s largest school districts took pay cuts or had their pay frozen at least one year between 2008 and 2012.
abstract: Report by National Council on Teacher Quality shows that teachers' pay suffered during recession and its aftermath, with most teachers in nation's largest school districts taking pay cuts or having their pay frozen at least one year between 2008 and 2012.
lead_paragraph: According to the report, most teachers in the nation’s largest school districts took pay cuts or had their pay frozen at least one year between 2008 and 2012.
